result.execSummary:
All charges against Michael Ray Burdick in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Ray Burdick is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Ray Burdick

Defendant Michael Ray Burdick not in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Michael Ray Burdick.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 17 pages) commencing 07-19-2022 by Danielle N. Holcomb.

Defendant Michael Ray Burdick not in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Michael Ray Burdick.  Attorney Ryan Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 10/17/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 29:
Defendant Michael Ray Burdick in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Michael Ray Burdick in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Franklin Police Officer A. Hempe. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court,appear by video. Defendant Michael Ray Burdick not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Ray Burdick in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Michael Ray Burdick in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea

Attorney Tom Reed in court, defendant Michael Ray Burdick not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a State V. Lee hearing.   Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel provides an update to the court. Court passes case to 1:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Ray Burdick not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR.29
Defendant Michael Ray Burdick not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Ray Burdick not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring for No Contact Order only.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.
Signed and filed, No Contact/Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.L.M.

Defendant Michael Ray Burdick in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael Ray Burdick in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Ray Burdick appeared by video means with Attorney.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2-4.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
